nodeMetric.field_description: Emails Sent is the number of contacts you sent your email to.This metric is generally the broadest list but excludes any previous hard bounces and recipients who unsubscribed. Depending on your email marketing platform, it might also exclude recipients who have shown repetitive low engagement.

body.processed: For list quality, you want to look at the deliverability rate, which divides Emails Delivered by Emails Sent.
body.summary: Emails Sent is the number of contacts who where sent your email.

field_related_metrics.field_description: Emails Delivered is the number of contacts who successfully received an email to their inbox and, as such, does not include bounces or unsubscribed recipients.

Emails Opened is the number of unique recipients who opened your email. Because the number of people who open your email impacts every other downstream metric, such as clicks, it makes sense to pay special attention to this one.
Emails Bounced is the count of emails that were not successfully delivered. Specifically, it's the count of Non-Delivery Receipts from your recipients' email servers.
